lines.content: I was walking around outside, when I saw a large tree with leaves, and a trunk made out of wood.
I thought to myself what a good-looking tree it was.
I pulled off a leaf and examin’d it. It appear’d leafy.
O Captain! my Captain! abandon ship!
I hear America singing, stop this awful poem.
I am a man, who, sauntering along without ever stopping,
Talks loquaciously for lines and lines, describing how good nature looks forever, expecting my readers to see my deep, mesmerizing imagery.
Such as a tree, made out of wood, with leaves, and branches.
Can you see the amazing tree I describ’d?
And I remember’d the wonderfulness of wandering around the country naked,
Until the police arrest’d me, of course.
Poetry must be free - from restrictive rules – from having to have any entertainment value.
Resist much, obey little people who a-trying to control you and make you enslav’d by quality.
Beginning my studies I have found this bad, and randomly sung to nature, because nature looks good.
Somebody will actually think this audacious poem is obscene, because I am definitely a rebel, albeit, a very boring one.
